SEARCH
Package com.ttc.fitPT.ptSchedule.service

Class UserService

java.lang.Object
com.ttc.fitPT.ptSchedule.service.UserService
@Service public class UserService extends Object
UserService provides functionalities related to user profile management, including fetching user details, changing passwords, and retrieving therapist certifications.

  • Constructor Details

    • UserService

      @Autowired public UserService(org.springframework.jdbc.core.JdbcTemplate jdbcTemplate)

  • Method Details

    • getUserDetails

      public Map<String,Object> getUserDetails(jakarta.servlet.http.HttpSession session)
      Fetches user details based on the user's role and adds relevant information to a map. This includes basic details for all users and specific details if the user is a therapist.
      Parameters:
      session - the current user session containing role and identification information.
      Returns:
      a map containing user information, such as role, full name, and specific details for therapists.

    • changeUserPassword

      public boolean changeUserPassword(int personId, String newUsername, String newPassword)
      Changes the password or username for a specified user.
      Parameters:
      personId - the unique identifier of the user whose details are being updated.
      newUsername - the new username to set (nullable).
      newPassword - the new password to set (nullable).
      Returns:
      true if the details were updated successfully, false otherwise.

    • getTherapistCertifications

      public List<Map<String,String>> getTherapistCertifications(int therapistId) throws Exception
      Retrieves certifications for a specified therapist by therapist ID. Each certification includes abbreviation, description, and therapy type.
      Parameters:
      therapistId - the unique identifier of the therapist.
      Returns:
      a list of maps, each containing certification details (abbreviation, description, and therapy type).
      Throws:
      Exception - if the stored procedure call fails or returns invalid data.
